author: Hookahey
message:
Hi Aurélien, useful tool.

I was looking for a preview possibility when editing markdown files with Kate for a while.

Some further ideas. Would be curious about your opinion on these:

I know you use custom front-ends/converters but have you seen Pandoc: http://pandoc.org/ ? It is quite powerful in the formats it can swallow and output. Might be interesting to use that as a parser+html renderer from different formats.

How about integrating parts of MUP into Okular? See https://bugs.kde.org/show_b...
As Okular is the "universal" document viewer for KDE it would be nice to extend it to be able to view some markup file types.

replies.author: Aurélien Gâteau
replies.message:
Hi,

MUP can already uses Pandoc to render Markdown. It should be easy to declare new converters for it if you need support for other markups.

Regarding Okular, integration would not be that easy because, Okular expects its generators to produce images (see http://quickgit.kde.org/?p=... ), whereas MUP converters produce HTML and relies on QtWebKit to turn the HTML into something to display.

replies.author: Hookahey
replies.message:
Hi

Aah ok, thanks for the clarification about Pandoc. Well I am fine with markdown for now ;). It was just an idea for having a broader input range. Now that I looked more closely at the github repo I realized you mention Pandoc there, looks like I missed it before.

Regarding Okular, guess it then would require using QtWebkit to render an image with links and feed that to Okular. Still doable but it should be an optional dependency of Okular I guess.

Thanks for the clarification
Hookahey
